Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in city center”
Reviews.Author: eetimle
Reviews.Content: Hotel is placed in old East Berlin centrum, about 150m from the closest metro station, Oranienburger Strasse. There are plenty of breakfast restaurants in the close neighbourghood, Rothaus very much recommended. Staff was nice and helpful and spoke good English. Rooms are bit out-of-date. We had a room, which was located to inner yard, so there wasn't any noise from the streets. Unfortunately the walls seem to be very thin. You could easily hear when neighbor is speaking to a phone, leaving the room etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ktrme
Reviews.Content: Great price - great experience. Good location - very quiet street, yet close to metro lines and a wide choice of restaurants & bars. The 'room' was actually a self-catering flat comprising a bedroom, living-room/kitchenette and a bathroom. Immaculate throughout and quiet at night. A large breakfast was included in the price and served in a pleasant dining area. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful - one person in particular at check-in went out of his way to make our stay memorable with his kindness and generosity. [7th & 8th March 2012. Room 162].

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Very Large and Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: lmm303
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a CONVENIENT LOCATION, just about a few minutes walk from the metro and only about 10 minute walk to Museum Island. There also were some grocery stores and convenience stores on Chausseestrasse. I recommend the larger Rewe grocery store (Chausseestr. 118-120), which is about a 10 minute walk northwest of the hotel. It was fun for buying local products such as German cookies and chocolates. The CUSTOMER SERVICE was also great, with staff being knowledgeable and very helpful. They were particularly helpful in trying to figure out how we could get to Tegel airport which does not have a train station connected. They recommended taking the U6 from Oranienburger-Tor (towards Alt-Tegel destination) and get off at Kurt-Schumacher-Platz, then take the bus TXL 128 to the airport. You may want to give yourself added time on the weekends as the buses/metro don't run as frequently early Sunday morning. The ROOM itself was super spacious for the 2 of us, with a tv, couch, closet and large bathroom. Although neither of us were physically challenged, I think we some how got the handicapable room which made it extra spacious in the room and bathroom. Not complaints on our end as we were free to spread our things around. Wifi access was great, as other hotels I've stayed in either had a weak signal or no signal from our room. We also had a quiet room facing the interior courtyard away from the street which was fantastic. As an aside from the hotel, if you're big on museums, I would recommend getting the MUSEUM PASS BERLIN card (19 Euro) as going to 2+ museums (each museum about 10 Euros each) pretty much pays for the card. It's a 3-day pass to visit to visit a ton of museums (which you can purchase at the museums) (for more info: http://www.smb.museum/smb/service/preise.php, and click on the link for the specific museums). You should know that some museums have special exhibits which are not part of the pass, and then strangely enough, there are some museums that the special exhibit must be paid for with an extra euro or 2 to enter even the main collection (e.g., Alte Nationalgalerie). Also you should also know that for each museum you get a FREE AUDIOGUIDE as part of your entrance fee (this is not true in many US museums were you often have to pay separately). Unfortunately I missed that at the first museum I visited (the Pergamonmuseum of all places) and was told when checking in at the second museum. Some of the museums also have late nights on Thursdays (until 10pm) or Saturdays (until 8 pm - Neues Museum), which is partly eery as it feels like you have the museum all to yourself with only the museum security about. So you may want to note the times of the museums you're interested in to maximize time at the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality relation”
Reviews.Author: Biajante
Reviews.Content: Positive: -Hotel's localization in a nice near center area -5 minutes waking to subway -No time limit for check-in (the only way to hand late flights as ours) -Rooms good insonorization -Good price/quality relation Negative: -We asked on booking.com for a double bed, but we got two single beds together. The recepcionist, not very kindly, said that as the hotel was fully booked they couldnt do anything about it (they should had thought on that before...) -Every morning we setted the heating level in our room in a specific level, that was always changed when we got back at night -Non confortable bed and pillows - back pains -The rug from the room halls has lots of spots on it, it should be changed -Expensive breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great area, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: simabo31
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin with my boyfriend for a city break. Despite not being enamoured of the city, I really liked the area this hotel is in. Full of nice pubs, bars and restaurants, but without being over the top. Our room was very comfortable and spotless. it was also really quiet, despite being very centrally located. really good value for money: seeing many hotels whilst walking around Berlin, we were so pleased we booked this one. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “thanks to other tripadvisor posters”
Reviews.Author: njp77
Reviews.Content: for this quiet hotel. My daughter and I stayed for three nights over a long October weekend. The room was clean and comfortable, a bit spartan but a request for extra pillows and towels was honored with a smile. The location is absolutely perfect, there's a wonderful breakfast place (Cafe Keyser Soze, of all things) across the street, two subway lines within a block, and walking distance to museums and other attractions. (If you visit Museum Isle on Saturday, there's a wonderful flea market right along the access street.) The neighborhood is fun and cool, if you get a chance check out Clarchen's ballroom down the block for dinner and dancing. On Expedia, this hotel cost us less than $80 a night, much less than a Hampton Inn or Ramada in the U.S. -- the best bargain of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location ...and very clean”
Reviews.Author: AngliA21
Reviews.Content: When choosing hotel for our first visit to Berin our friends advised us Adlon or similar but we never regret we stayed in Augustinenhof. First of all, it's very German - very clean, a bit ascetic but with its own history and evangelistic background. Secondly, it's astonishingly quiet given that this is a very center of everything in Berlin and literally 2-3 minutes walk to all that you want. So, I cannot avoid mentioning its superb location as well as other reviewers did. Thirdly, the hotel staff - very welcoming, modest and conscientious, very nice and helpful people. The only disappointment was breakfast - I didn't mind it was very basic but it was just absolutely not tasty, even the bread and butter. But at the end of the day we didn't care as it gave us a good chance to spend half of a day in a very long and relaxed breakfast in one of the beautiful street cafes just 50 meters from Augustinenhof. So - very good choice for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJClem
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Augustinenhof can't be beat! It's in the perfect location, in Mitte just blocks from Museum Island. Public transportation is easily accessible in a few minutes and there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. The staff is helpful (and speaks English) and the free wireless worked quite well. A full breakfast was included, served buffet style in the restaurant next door, and was one of the best we've ever had in Europe. The room was immaculate and comfortable (we had a junior suite) and we didn't experience any street or hallway noise. We highly recommend this hotel to all categories of travelers and would definitely stay here if we return to Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TravellerJohn
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, quiet, well-run hotel in central Berlin. Five minutes walk from S-Bahn Oranienburgerstrasse in one direction or U-Bahn Oranienburger Tor in the other, one change for Airport train. E6.50 gets you into town from the airport and all day on the fantastic public transport system. Friendly, helpful staff, spacious, comfortable room, good shower. BBC World & CNN in Enlglish on TV. Affordable mini-bar. Quiet street (Some road works outside but no noise - good insulation). Plenty to eat for breakfast. Lots of good cafes and restaurants nearby. Walking distance to museum quarter. Very pleased overall with this hotel, ideal retreat after a busy day exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ann_BobOttawa_ON
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights earlier this week. We found it comfortable, in a great location and very good value. Complimentary Internet was also available in the rooms. wonderful breakfasts included.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieC80
Reviews.Content: We spent a night and would have liked to have stayed another. The hotel is charming, small, warm, and great value. It's near all the places you want to go and staff are helpful and friendly. Good breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Skinnyjohn
Reviews.Content: Me and two friends stayed at Hotel Augustinenhof for a long weekend in November. The hotel staff were helpful even before we arrived by dealing with my room queries beforehand via email (in English) and then accomodating a last minute change of plans when a triple room was required. We arrived too early in the morning to get to our rooms, but our bags were kept securely while we went off to discover Berlin. The hotel is in the Mitte district of former East-Berlin, which meant that it had more character and a youthful, alternative feel to it. On many corners were cafe's that turned into bars in the evening allowing for long, late slow drinking and eating. The area felt safe and friendly. Our room was spacious, clean, new looking and very quiet (even with building work happening across the road). The TV had no English speaking channels, but who cares. Breakfast was a mixture of continental and cooked food and served until 10am. We didn't eat dinner there as there are many other places to eat in the area. Staff were always friendly and spoke excellent English - they even posted me an undeveloped camera film that we had left in the room - I suspect most hotels wouldn't have bothered. If you are looking for a clean, friendly, good value (£30 pp per night) hotel in an interesting area of Berlin, near the U-Bahn - you should give the Hotel Augustinenhof serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Eltel6
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. Its located in the trendy Auguststrasse area, full of art galleries and stylish restaurants. Its also walking distance to Hackescher Markt, which has wonderful shops and beautiful architecture, built around a series of inner courtyards. The area is ever so slightly rough around the edges, but not at all unsafe - just still a bit of post-unification restoration taking place. Its a 10 minute walk to the museum island, and a short hop on the U-Bahn to other sights. The hotel itself is a restored religious hostel, built in the 19th century. Its spotlessly clean, with the original wooden floors and original art works everywhere. The beds are outrageously comfortable, and on the coldest day of the year with a foot of snow on the ground, it was snug and cosy. Plus there's a sauna, and a lavish breakfast buffet - I was usually too full to eat lunch. The young staff are friendly and smoothly professional. Go - Berlin is a fascinating city and this is a great little hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Augustinenhof
HotelInfo.Address: Auguststrasse 82, 10117 Berlin, Germany
